result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvester June Batton Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered with tax intercept.
To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil  judgment with tax intercept and other means.

superMiscConds.notes:
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.
Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
Complete any and all other counseling deemed appropriate.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment.  Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sylvester June Batton Jr

records.addlTxt:
Certification of SENTENCING transcript commencing MAY 25, 2016, received and filed. (27 Pages)
Copy of transcript forwarded to:  REQUIRED BY STATUTE

Defendant Sylvester June Batton in court with attorney Debra Jeanne Patterson.  Defendant Sylvester June Batton in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.  Additional statements by: Paige S.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of THIRTY-EIGHT (38) MONTHS, with credit for ONE HUNDRED FIFTEEN (115) DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is  FOURTEEN (14) MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is TWENTY-FOUR (24) MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Complete any and all other counselling deemed appropriate.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol. 
* Random urine screens.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH Tax Intercept.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment WITH Tax Intercept or other means.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FOR PURPOSES OF THE SENTENCING IN BRANCH 33.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.

Defendant Sylvester June Batton in court with attorney Paige Aleece Styler.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. 

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and elements received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months to 18 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
